de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization

Class WaypointsSync

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization.WaypointsSync

  • public class WaypointsSync
extends java.lang.Object
    Pushes Waypoint table parameters in the Local Database to the Server. Reads all the parameters of DatabaseHelper.waypointsTable from the Database and stores it in HashMaps. Creates StringRequests and inserts it in to a RequestQueue to push and pull Data from the Server. Clears the Waypoint Table before inserting Data that was pulled from the Server.

    Uses Waypoints to create a new Waypoint and insert into local Database, the parameters that is pulled from the Server.

    See Also:
    DatabaseHelper.waypointsTable, SyncActivity, Waypoints, de.awi.floenavigation.synchronization

      • onClickWaypointsReadButton

        See Also:
        waypointsCursor

      • formatUpdateTime

        private java.lang.String formatUpdateTime(double updateTime)

      • onClickWaypointsSyncButton

        public void onClickWaypointsSyncButton()
        Creates StringRequests as per the size of labelIDData data extracted from the local database and inserts all the requests in the RequestQueue A Stringrequest request for pushing the data is registered and added to the requestQueue. callback function Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) notifies whether the request was successful or not If it is unsuccessful or the connection is not established Response.Listener#error(VolleyError) gets called

      • onClickWaypointsPullButton

        public void onClickWaypointsPullButton()
        Function is used to pull data from internal database to the server A Stringrequest request for pulling the data is registered and added to the requestQueue. callback function Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) notifies whether the request was successful or not If it is unsuccessful or the connection is not established Response.Listener#error(VolleyError) gets called On pulling the data from the server internal database tables DatabaseHelper.waypointsTable and DatabaseHelper.waypointDeletedTable are cleared.

        The server sends the data in .xml format, therefore it has to extract the data based on the tags Inside Response.Listener#onResponse(Object) it loops through the entire xml file till it reaches the end of document. Based on the XmlPullParser.START_TAG, XmlPullParser.TEXT, XmlPullParser.END_TAG it adds the values received to the corresponding columns of the DatabaseHelper.waypointsTable Each waypoints is added to the waypointsList which is individually taken and added to the internal database.

      • getDataCompleted

        public boolean getDataCompleted()

      • setBaseUrl

        public void setBaseUrl(java.lang.String baseUrl,
                       java.lang.String port)
        Used to initialize URL, pullURL and deleteURL
        Parameters:
        baseUrl - Url set by the administrator, which is stored in the local database
        port - port number set by the administrator, which is stored in the local database (default value is 80)

      • sendWaypointDeleteRequest

        private void sendWaypointDeleteRequest()
        Reads the Table and inserts the data from all the Columns of the Table in to their respective HashMap.
        Throws:
        android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException - In case of error in reading database After reading the data, it creates string requests to forward the data to the server This facilitates the server to know which LabelIDs should be marked for deletion since these Waypoint are no longer used.
